site_name: CHARLES Mc GINNIS & DEBBI Mc GINNIS

citations.narrative:
***Eight adult dogs in outdoor housing did not have any shade at the time of the inspection. Several of the dogs were
panting intermittently. A lack of shade can cause dogs to become too hot, resulting in discomfort, heat stress, and
possible heat stroke. The licensee must ensure that one or more separate areas of shade are provided at all times of the
day and that the area(s) of shade are large enough for all animals in the enclosure at the same time to protect the dogs
from the direct rays of the sun. TO BE CORRECTED BY APRIL 30, 2024.
***An adult male Boxer had an outdoor shelter that was too short to allow the dog to stand upright in the shelter. Shelters
that are too small cause discomfort and stress and may not fully protect the animal from the elements. The licensee must
ensure that shelters are large enough to allow each animal to sit, stand, lie, and turn about freely. TO BE CORRECTED
BY APRIL 25, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
